headline: Homemade Mac and Cheese
description: This mac and cheese recipe is easy to make from scratch, so skip the box! Start with an easy roux which turns into a decadent creamy cheese sauce.

video.description: See how to make a velvety, five-star macaroni and cheese.
video.name: Homemade Mac and Cheese

name: Homemade Mac and Cheese
recipeIngredient: 2.5 cups milk, or more as needed
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease an 8-inch square baking dish.

Make the macaroni and cheese: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add macaroni and simmer, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 8 minutes; it will finish cooking in the oven. Drain and transfer to the prepared baking dish.
While the macaroni is cooking, melt 1/4 cup butter in a medium skillet over low heat. Whisk in flour and stir until the mixture becomes paste-like and light golden brown, 3 to 5 minutes.

Gradually whisk 2 1/2 cups milk into the flour mixture, and bring to a simmer. Stir in shredded Cheddar and finely grated Parmesan cheeses; season with salt and pepper. Cook and stir over low heat until cheese is melted and sauce has thickened, 3 to 5 minutes, adding up to 1/2 cup more milk if needed. Pour cheese sauce over macaroni and stir until well combined.

Make the bread crumb topping: Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add bread crumbs; cook and stir until well coated and browned. Spread bread crumbs over macaroni and cheese, then sprinkle with paprika.
Bake in the preheated oven until topping is golden brown and macaroni and cheese is bubbling, about 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I doubled it … I cannot imagine using an 8x8 pan for the original recipe….I used a large oval deep dish .. 9x13 type … and still had enough left for a 24oz pan. Also I was thrown by the roux becoming a paste!?!? It all turned out though…my normal recipe is in Joy of Cooking… it’s packed bc I’ve moved.
I use crushed ritz crackers instead of breadcrumbs, and I add a little extra cheddar cheese. Came out good. Made this a couple of times now.
It was easy-to-make and very delicious my son love it.
Perfect dinner for 2 nights

If you are making it for kids, it is perfect, reduce the amount of milk and add a little half-and-half. 2 cups total is plenty. If you are lactose, intolerant oat milk works fine. If you are making it for adults, you need to spice it up. It’s a bit bland.

I chose this recipe because I needed to use up milk and Cheddar cheese. It worked very well. Since I'm Gluten Free I used Potato Starch instead of flour. I think 2 cups milk would have been sufficient and I'll try that the next time. I didn't read any reviews until after I made it and would agree that the Parmesan gave it a gritty texture but I like the flavor it gave the sauce. I did not use the crumb topping.
Made it , first time, looked really good, but turned out very dry, not sure why
Used can of evaporated milk plus milk to 2.5 cups. Added garlic and onion powder
Made it and my family raved about it!
So easy to make for sure and it was delicious 😋 everyone loved it
I made a little twist with it, I added nutmeg and paprika in the sauce. I used sharp cheddar. And sprinkle smoked paprika on top. Great recipe
Family loved this recipe - only change was to double up the bread crumb topping

I made this like 4 times. I will say the first time i added then paprika on top and wasn’t a fan. 2nd time i used Parmesan grated and wasn’t a fan it got to thick. 3. Used and grated cheeses instead of bag and omg so delicious. 4. Used bacon and wow i loved it!!! I will definitely try with evaporated milk to see if it comes out creamier but everyone loved it!
Added to Favorite Recipes: I have always made my mother's mac-n- cheese recipe. I'm sorry Mom, but this mac-n-cheese was wonderfully creamy & tasty (although much higher in calories than Mom's)
Not a fan of Parm in this dish so I used sharp white cheddar and smoked cheddar! Also used evaporated milk and a tsp of gr mustard and smoked paprika! Loved it!
It looks delicious. I snuck a bite and yum!

no bread crumbs or paprika. I just grated extra cheese to form a cheesy layer on top that will get crispy. I didn't have the parmesan cheese. Next time! I like the bacon crumbles idea. so versatile! I'll save the leftovers as described for the rest of the week.
Great recipe! Substituted two cans of evaporated milk, added dry mustard and paprika, and used sharp cheddar and Gruyère with little parmesean. Delicious!
I added some onion and some nutmeg to deepen the flavor of the cheese but the Parmesan add was awful! It left it super grainy. The breadcrumbs were just gross!
Great creamy flavourful pasta dish.

Doubled the batch and it came out perfectly delicious! Baked it in a 9x13 pan and it was bubbly and browned. I did use the large elbow macaroni for the doubled recipe. Maybe that's why it wasn't soupy as some other reviews had mentioned when they doubled it. Anyway, I will definitely make it again. Big hit with the family!
Love to bake that 🙏
Loved it! I only substituted the milk, I used evaporate mlk instead
I substituted the milk with evaporated milk and used Panko Japanese bread crumbs. Was really good.

Fabulous! Creamy I added Italian seasoning, little onion powder dash extra rosemary. Also, To the name caller: Happy Thanksgiving, and to be such a "GREAT COOK" why use the recipe if it came out poorly I would consider to recheck your skills .

The flavor was good but not as creamy as I like. I added extra milk and cheese and used 1/2 the amount of flour and still not creamy. I also added onion, garlic, smoked paprika and mustard. I used a combination of cheddar, Swiss, Colby and cream cheese.
this was super good, awesome recipe! :)
kudos
amazing!
I really wanted to like this recipe. The recipe has potential. I think next time, I will add some different cheeses such as white cheddar cheese, Mexican cheese blend and some evaporated milk.

Thanks for the recipe 😍😍 The way I normally cook this dish at my restaurant is that I add a little bit more cheese to make it more creamier. But apart from that this recipe is great. 👉 Feel free to check out my recipes that I use at my restaurant by visiting my profile 🤗 Enjoy!
So good
Great!
added more pasta and used rotini

I always make this recipe and I always make the following changes: A) For the macaroni, I use the macaroni from a box of Kraft mac and cheese. Then I use the powder from that box instead of any shredded cheeses. This recipe ends up WAY too salty after I add salt and pepper to taste, so I add a cup of white sugar to balance to flavor (I used brown sugar once and it was even better, but my recipe is white sugar). I wanted to give this recipe 10/10 stars, but I guess 5/5 will do, because they both add up to 1 when you do all the math.
Love this recipe. I added some chopped and drained stewed tomatoes and some diced tomatoes w/mild chili peppers. So delicious! 😋

I have used this recipe ALOT of times,However I did make several changes,I cut down the flour to only half,also I added minced onion and garlic and pepper but I ALWAYS ADD MORE MILK AND CHEESE to make creamier.

This is a fantastic recipe! The only thing I changed was adding some hot sauce into the cheese sauce as I found it helped with the richness. I also recommend playing around with your cheese selection! We added some goat this time while making it and it added a lovely complexity.
It was really good, but I don't like the breadcrumbs on it.

I am surprised at all of the 5 star reviews. This was dry, not creamy and not cheesy enough. I subbed panko for the bread crumbs and that was the best part of the dish. Sorry, but I will not make this again.
Well received
its really good
Delicious!! The flavors are amazing!
Came out amazing! I added hatch chili in the sauce and baked it. Added seasoning garlic salt, salt, and pepper. I felt the recipe was lacking basic seasonings.
Very easy to follow Cant wait to serve it for dinner tonight. I ended up doubling the receipe

The only thing I changed, was the cheeses. I used, cheddar, little mozzarella, Colby jack, and Gruyère. Everything was fantastic! Next time, after reading the reviews maybe adding additional spices. This recipe was not floury or gritty. Will make again!

This was the first time I have ever made baked macaroni and cheese. I loved it!! Easy recipe and very good. I did however, add some garlic and dried mustard due to the other reviews. I will make this again!!!
This was THE BEST mac and cheese recipe I have ever used! But, I used panko bread crumbs and added parmesan cheese to the topping! Delicious!
Made many times. We always double it! Very yummy !

Every year, my wife and I host a party during the summer. I made this recipe a few years ago and it was a HIT! So much that we ran out very quickly. This year, I multiplied the recipe for 48 people and STILL ran out!
Not cheesy enough and too much bread crumbs
Yum it was good only change i made was using mild cheddar and still turned out great

This recipe is a favorite in our house. We usually have to double the recipe, because everyone wants some for lunch the next day. We owe many thanks to Judy for submitting this recipe! For fun, we have tried some variations that get raves from our children: - we switch the elbow macaroni for bow-tie pasta (16 oz), and - we use Asiago cheese instead of Parmesan - we also like the texture if/when we add onion and 3-4 handfuls of spinach - finally we add smoked or Italian sausage or both (1/2 pound each)
The recipe was good. I'm not sure why but the cheese curdled a little but don't take away from the taste. I will try it again because it is still good.
Amazing! I used 1/2 & 1/2 heavy cream instead of milk.

I thought it came out very good for my first mac and cheese. I do not make these types of dishes for health reasons, but it was my son in laws birthday and one of his favorite foods. With that said, I thought it came out excellent and so did all who ate it. At first I felt the sauce needed more milk as the recipe suggested which I did after cooking on the stovetop, then when i poured it into the cassarole dish, I thought I made amistake because it looked too soupy. However, after cooking in the oven for about 30 minutes it certainly firmed up to a perfect consistency; not too dry, and not too wet. Personally, I would have liked to jazz this up a bit more in the flavor department. I thought the filling was very one dimensional meaning very cheesy but that's it. I think I would like to see some other elements added to it whether some type of pork flavoring, vegetable, or a bit of heat maybe with a touch of cayenne pepper. However, that is my preference. For a conventional Mac and Cheese, this recipe hit the mark. Just don't think about counting calories LOL.
Needs the full two cups of cheddar.

My family of 3 enjoyed this recipe. I served it alongside grilled cheeseburgers and French fries for a quick & easy weekend meal. I altered the order of the steps to reduce the amount of cookware to wash. First, I used Panko breadcrumbs that I browned with the butter in my LC braiser and set aside when browned. Then I made the roux and bechamel in the same braiser while the pasta was cooking in another pot. I added the al dente macaroni to the cheese sauce in the braiser, mixed well, topped with a little extra shredded cheese and the browned Panko breadcrumbs and finished in the oven. All together I used about 1 1/3 blocks of sharp cheddar and good 1/3 of the wedge of Parmigiano-Reggiano. A couple nights later to serve leftovers as meatless main course with a green salad, I made a cream sauce reduction ( #ChefJohn #FoodWishes) added a little extra cheddar and parm and a few good dashes of Sriracha sauce. Warmed low & slow on stovetop until combined and hot. The Panko and cheese topping from the original cooking melted deliciously into the new sauce. Result was thick & bubbly & gooey & cheesy. Thank you for a great recipe - so very versatile.
I added ham and a little Cholula sauce. Good recipe.

LOVED THIS RECIPE, SO EASY, SO GOOD. SHOULD GIVE A COUPLE TIPS ON IT THOUGH, LIKE DON'T USE PRE-SHREDDED CHEESE, TOO MUCH ADDED STUFF IN IT CHANGES THE FLAVOR TO A FLOUR LIKE BASE. ALSO, ADD ONION OR GARLIC TO ADD MORE FLAVOR TO IT. OTHERWISE LOVED IT!

Not bad but only 8oz uncooked macaroni with 3 cups milk! I used 10 onces and still too runny. Followed directions to a T. Next time I'll cut back to only 2 cups milk and 1 half stick butter..not a whole stick. Other than that..pretty good.
The best recipe ever!
Quick and easy !
Very easy and delicious
Soo good so cheesy and such a easy versatile recipe!♡
, Really good , a little messy but... Ummmmmm
I used 1 cup sharp cheddar; 1.5 cups gruyere and 1 cup fontina... Just because these are some of my favorite cheeses! The gruyere makes it so silky! Very easy to make & very versatile recipe!

I’ve made this recipe 4 times and it’s always so easy to make. I added Italian seasoning, garlic powder, paprika, black pepper, and garlic powder to the base and I substituted the bread crumbs with Italian style bread crumbs. I sprinkled bacon bits as well.
I would use a sharper cheese..even a little smoked cheese

This wasn’t bad but it wasn’t mind blowing. Pretty basic Mac n cheese, good texture, not dry or too liquidy. Like others I added dry mustard and paprika to the mixture with a little extra salt which gave it a hint of more flavor.
Best Mac and cheese ever! I added some bacon to it before baking...
Very good. Maybe a little bit more cheese

I didn't like the recipe it's very plain. I added chicken and vegetables to it to make it better and it was still 2 star meal in my opinion. I was wanting more of a rich and creamy Mac with a crispy outer layer but it wasn't the case.
Incredibly easy and delicious! This is a winner.

My teenaged nephew and I made this to take to a cookout. We doubled the recipe. It was really good and he got tons of complements on it, there was not a single piece of macaroni left in the dish! We did add a little garlic and onion powder to it. We will make it often, it's easy to make and everyone loves it!
Morbuis made change my veiws on this and life

It was Amazing. The only thing I did different is use a 1/4 cup more of Italian style bread crumbs cuz I really like that crunchy topping. Other than that, props to the creator in of this recipe. 😋😋😋 This is my first time commenting but I have tried many, many of your recipes and love them all.
The best tasting mac and cheese I've ever had...very tasty and you can pretty much use or add any kind of cheese you want..YUM!!

Excellent recipe! Easy to make. I added already shredded cheese mix because I didn’t have Parmesan to shred. I think it might have been a little better with Parmesan but I just added a few herbs and spices to make it tastier. I also added frozen shrimp and broccoli. All delicious additions. lol.

I deviated a bit. I used cheese we had on hand- sharp and mild cheddar with about 1/2 c parmesan cheese. I decreased the milk( combo of 1/2 whipping cream and 1/2 evaporated milk) by about 2/3 cups. I added seasoning to the mixture as cheese melted. Mixture of 1/2 tsp each - garlic powder, onion powder, Old Bay. Dash of salt and about 1/4 tsp ground pepper. Added more seasoning to taste. We like Old Bay. Used Penne pasta instead of elbow. For the top— I increased the bread crumbs by 1/2 c , butter increased by 1 tsp. Baked about 30 min We all enjoyed it.
good recipe

My kids loved it and it’s even better reheated. We have made it a few times now and I have changed up the types of cheese a few times. The best we have found, so far, is parmaesan cheese and medium cheddar.
It is amazing I put som stuff of my own on it ind it is so good
Very easy to make! Simple ingredients! Whole family loved it!
I just added an extra cup of cheddar..
Great Mac and cheese recipe. Creamy and delicious yet still holds up to cutting pieces for serving. I fox this at all the holidays because everyone loves it.
My family and friends love when I make this. It is delicious

I made an account just to give this bad review!!! Way too much milk. I doubled the recipe for Easter dinner for family. Right now I have a casserole dish in the oven full of milk. I didn't even bother trying to float the bread crumbs on top. I will try to cook it down and see if I can save it, but I doubt it. Grocery prices the way they are, I just lost $40 and still need to come up with another dish for my family!
I made it exactly per the instructions! It was awful bland tastes like noodles and flour! Augh..
Added more cheese and fried diced hot dogs. Was delicious.

Yummy yummy! I also added a little garlic powder and mustard powder for a little extra kick. So so delicious. There are many ways you doctor this up and add additions that you may prefer for your Mac and cheese.

Great base recipe! I followed other reviewer's suggestions and added 1 tsp onion powder, 1 TBSP dry minced garlic, 1/2 tsp dry mustard, and 1/2 to 1 tsp black pepper to taste. I also use used half evaporated milk and half whole milk. It was a hit!!!!
Yummy

I did not modify other than holding back on the paprika. I doubled the batch because we are a family of 8. The entire family had a second helping and was a wonderful meatless dish served with Ceasar salad! Definitely making this again.

Recipe has no salt. I didn't realize this until I was sliding it in the oven, and it was quite obviously missing when tasting the finished product. Also, there is way too much milk in this recipe. I doubled the recipe (and yes I doubled everything, no mistakes) and found that the macaroni was drowned in the sauce. A quick reference to several other Mac and cheese recipes showed that there's 1.5 times as much milk as there should be. So instead of eating this a soup, I had to discard a lot of the cheese sauce. Once I added salt on the plate, the Mac and cheese was fine but I'm just left wondering how much richer this would have tasted if so much cheese sauce wasn't wasted. Also, forgetting to include salt in the recipe is inexcusable.
Very good. Breadcrumbs added a satisfying crunch. I added black pepper. Next time I will add some red pepper flakes to give it more warmth as it was a little bland.
Really good! I was trying to find something similar to my grand moms, close!! Thank you for a great dinner plan 🤗
My family love it so much they said it was better than the box kind!
